task.title: View test scripts uploaded from a Git repository

taskbody.context: After uploading your scripts from the Git repository, to view test cases and test suites uploaded from a Git repository, follow these steps:

step.cmd: After uploading your test scripts from a Git repository:

li.p: If you want to view uploaded test cases, go to > Test Cases.
If you want to view uploaded test suites, go to > Test Suites.

info.p: You can see all folders corresponding to your uploaded Git repositories displayed under the Uploaded Data folder. The following picture shows the script repository folder in the Test Cases page.

image.alt: View uploaded test cases from the Git repo

li.p: It may take a few minutes for the uploaded test scripts to appear.

step.cmd: You can also view all test run results in this tab. If your test results are not from the uploaded test scripts, they are in the Uploaded Data folder.

li.p: If you have not run tests yet, the execution data is empty.
If you have run tests, this section contains information from your test execution.

In the Test Cases page, you can see the following data for each test case: Last execution, Last updated, No. of execution, Average Duration, Flakiness (%). If you have linked Jira requirements to a TestOps test case, you can see the Jira ticket ID in the Requirements column.

image.alt: View test results in the test management tab

li.p: TestOps only shows the number of executions of the test cases that have been executed from 1/1/2022 (ICT) onwards.
In the Test Suites page, you can see the total number of test execution, the Last updated and Last executed data.

image.alt: View test suite results in the Test Management tab

step.cmd: If you can't find a script repository, refresh it. To do so, follow these steps:

substep.cmd: Select the script repository you want to refresh.
Click Refresh Test Suite Collection in the top right corner.
Go to > Test Cases/Test Suites to check the results. You should see the test cases/ test suites from the uploaded Git repository here.

taskbody.result: Once done checking your uploaded test scripts in , you can start organizing your test scripts into test suites for execution.
